dashboard.trafic.title: Traffic status ( Sent and Receive, Types and  Load)
dashboard.sent.title: Messages sent
dashboard.trafic.total.trafic.sent.label: Sent
dashboard.sent.comment:
Tx = number of sent messages
ReTx = number of Re-Transmissions done. This should be 0, but if the plugin is trying to send a command to a powered off device, you can get ReTx
dashboard.trafic.maxload.label: Load
dashboard.received.title: Messages received
dashboard.received.comment:
Rx = number of received messages
Cluster = type of message with information
CRC error = number of messages with errors
dashboard.trend.title: Statistics
dashboard.trend.comment:
Tx/s = number of sent messages per second
Rx/s = number of received messages per second
Load = number of messages in queue
dashboard.devices.title: Device status (Type, Health and Battery level)
dashboard.device.title: Total of devices managed by the plugin
dashboard.devices.label: Devices
dashboard.devices.comment:
Routers are main powered device which participates in the mesh network.
End device is a device, which is not capable of routing messages, and which is not listening while idle (most of the time, it is a battery based device)
dashboard.healthgraph.title: Health
dashboard.health.comment:
Live = devices alive
Lost = devices away from the network
No news = devices which haven't reported on the last 6 hours
Unknown = devices with status unknown

After a plugin restart, all devices are moved to status unknown until a message is received by ZiGate.
dashboard.battery.comment: For devices equiped with a battery, here after is reported the battery status.
dashboard.devices.state.label: Health
dashboard.battery.title: Battery
dashboard.devices.battery.label: Battery
dashboard.plugin.update.available: There is an update available for the plugin
dashboard.plugin.update.available.title: Plugin update
dashboard.firmware.update.available: A new firmware is available for the ZiGate More infos .
dashboard.plugin.subtitle: Provides plugin informations
dashboard.stats.subtitle: Provides ZiGate statistics in terms of message transmission and reception
dashboard.zigate.subtitle: Provides Coordinator informations
dashboard.health.title: Health of plugin
device.byname.subtitle:
List all HW devices paired with the plugin, and allow you to enter a friendly name for each device
It shows the friendly device name in the network section instead of a four digit code.
device.byname.alert.title: Delete device ?
device.byname.alert.subject: Are you sure ?
device.byname.parameter.alert.title: Parameters
device.byname.parameter.alert.subject: Set specific parameters
group.create.subtitle:
Allow edit, create and remove groups
Before modifications, make a full group analisys on the page Admin > Groups.
Before validation, make sure that all routers are connected to the ZigBee network.
After validation, make a special analisys on the router(s) in order to check that the changes have been taken.
Do not do all changes at once, but prefer to do it step by step with small changes.
group.reloadplugin.alert.title: Plugin Reload
group.reloadplugin.alert.subject: Groups have been updated, plugin need to be restarted
header.popover.title: Restart needed
header.popover.text: Some changes are pending a plugin restart is needed
network.topo.subtitle: List of the saved reports
network.topo.visu.subtitle: The Topology diagram shows all links between 2 nodes. If you leave the cursor on a link you'll see the link direction as well as the link quality (from 0 to 255 = best).
network.topo.visu.network.subtitle: Will draw a network graph of your Zigbee environment.
network.topo.device.visu.subtitle: Provides the list of devices managed by coordinator. You'll get also a reference to the Widget names and some other information from Domoticz
network.topo.device.visu.chart.title: Mesh Diagram
network.topology.req.subtitle: This will trigger a Topology scan, which will run in the background
network.stats.subtitle: List of saved reports
network.inter.req.subtitle: An Interference scan report will be provided. It will report Interference level between routers and coordinator.  The higher the value, the worst it is.
network.full.req.subtitle:
As for the short Interference scan, the report will provide Interference level between all routers and ZiGate, handling all cross-communications.
This report might take a while when the number of routers is high, n((n-1)/2), for 5 routers it is 10 combinations, for 10 routers 45
network.stats.detail.visu.chart.title: Interference level
admin.permittojoin.label: Accept new hardware
admin.assistprovisionning.title: Pairing a new device with the assitant
admin.assistprovisionning.subtitle: Click on Pairing and follow the instructions
admin.assistprovisionning.alert.title: Pairing assistant - Waiting for new device
admin.assistprovisionning.alert.subject: Make a Reset on your device to lunch the pairing process. Refer to the device documentation if needed.
admin.assistprovisionning.alert.Failed: Failed (Something went wrong, check the log for more details)
admin.assistprovisionning.alert.inDB: Successful (check if widgets have been created)
admin.permittojoin.title: Pairing a new device for a period of time
admin.permittojoin.subtitle: Click on the button to choise the period of time
admin.permittojoinrouter.title: Pairing a new device on a router
admin.permittojoinrouter.subtitle: Permit to pair a device on a specific router
admin.fullreset.title: Preparing device for full reset
admin.fullreset.subtitle: If you want to do a hard reset of an existing provisionned device in Domoticz, it is advised to indicate the plugin of such event happening. Then the plugin will make sure to redo a full device discovery and set whatever as been set during the first pairing
admin.recreate.title: Recreate widget(s) of existing device
admin.recreate.subtitle: Will crete or recreate all widgets of a given device. It will use the latest configuration if applicable. You might get duplication widgets in Domoticz, so make sure to remove those.
admin.rescan.group.title: Complete analysis of the groups
admin.rescan.group.subtitle:
Ask each router to know if it belongs to one or more groups
The result wil be in the Group management.

Make sure ALL the routers are connected to the ZigBee network before launching the analysis.
admin.scan.group.device.title: Selective analysis of the groups
admin.scan.group.device.subtitle:
Ask one or more router(s) to know if it (they) belong(s) to one or more groups
The result wil be in the Group management.

Make sure ALL the routers are connected to the ZigBee network before launching the analysis.
admin.swreset.title: ZiGate Soft reset
admin.swreset.subtitle: Will restart ZiGate (no loss of paired devices)
admin.switchchannel.title: Coordinator change channel
admin.switchchannel.subtitle: Will change the coordinator channel to the selected one, and will broadcast the change. ATTENTION, while routers usally switch to the new channel, none Zigbee 3.0 End Device won't and you will have to reset them to get them rejoining the new channel
admin.erasepdm.title: Erase ZiGate
admin.erasepdm.subtitle:
Will erase the permanent data memory of ZiGate (You will lose all paired devices)
You must enable the eraseZigatePDM parameter in Advanced Setting before
admin.erasepdm.alert.title: Erase ZiGate, Are you sure ?
admin.erasepdm.alert.subject: ATTENTION, last chance !!!!!
admin.reloadplugin.alert.title: Restart plugin, Are you sure ?
admin.reloadplugin.alert.subject: ATTENTION, last chance !!!!!
admin.reloadplugin.title: Restart plugin
admin.reloadplugin.subtitle: Will restart the plugin
admin.firmware.title: Devices firmware
admin.firmware.subtitle: Update routers firmware
admin.firmware.alert.title: title alert
admin.firmware.alert.subject: subject alert
setting.subtitle:
Allow you to visualize and edit the various plugin settings
Some require a restart of the plugin.
setting.help.link: More information on the settings can be found on the Wiki
setting.help.legend: These are all plugin settings which can be updated.
setting.subtitle.Services: Enable the services you want to be active
resetPermit2Join: Reset permit to join at startup
setting.reloadplugin.alert.title: Plugin Reload
setting.reloadplugin.alert.subject: Settings have been updated, plugin need to be restarted
setting.resetplugin.alert.title: ZiGate Reset
setting.resetplugin.alert.subject: Settings have been updated, Coordinator need to be reset (most likely , all deices wll required to be re-pair)
setting.eraseplugin.alert.title: Erase PDM
setting.eraseplugin.alert.subject: Settings have been updated, PDM need to be erased (all devices will required to be pair again)
setting.subtitle.DomoticzEnvironment: Setting on how to access Domoticz API
setting.subtitle.DeviceManagement: Here are all settings related to Devices and how the coordinator interact with them
setting.subtitle.ZigateConfiguration: Here are all settings related to the ZiGate hardware.
setting.subtitle.OverTheAirUpgrade: These are all settings related to the Over The Air upgrade functionnality.
setting.subtitle.Legrand: Allow to set a number of Legrand specifics options
setting.subtitle.Schneider Wiser: Allow to enable some specific mecanishm, and some other options
waitingOTA: delay when starting the OTA process
setting.subtitle.GroupManagement: Here are all setting to enable and configure the Group management feature.
OnIfOneOn: Group is On if one device is On (otherwise needs all devices On)
setting.subtitle.PluginConfiguration: Here are all Plugin environements settings
setting.subtitle.Provisioning: Special settings for special devices or special conditions
setting.subtitle.DevicePolling: Allow you to specify the polling frequency per type of information. Be aware that a high frequency will overload the ZiGate and might cause some performance issues
logLQI: Delay before starting a Topology scan (sec)
setting.header.CommandTransition: Command transitions for Lights in Groups
setting.subtitle.CommandTransition: For Groups only. You can specify the transition time in 10th of seconds with which the transition from current to target stage. For example how many 10th of second it will take to move from the current Color to the Color I requested via Domoticz. Color temp is used for White Color
setting.subtitle.Experimental: Use it only if you have been asked to
tools.debugcommand.title: Direct commands
tools.debugcommand.subtitle:
Allow to interact directly with a device, with a set of commands based on the device capabilities
(1) Select the device,
(2) Select the action you want to perform,
(3) Select a potential device type which can influence the way to interact with the device,
(4) Optionaly you might have to enter a Value or select a Color.
tools.rawcommand.title: ZiGate command (raw)
tools.rawcommand.subtitle:
Allow to send a ZiGate command directly tothe coordinator in raw mode.
You must follow the ZiGate protocol .
tools.binding.title: Device Binds
tools.binding.subtitle:
Allow to bind a cluster between source and target devices
e.g. If you want to bind a Temperature sensor with an Actuator, the SourceIEEE/Ep will be the Temperature sensor, the DestIEEE/Ep will be the actuator and the Cluster will be 0402 (Temperature Measurement)
setting.subtitle.VerboseLogging: Will allow you to enable/disable some Logging features
tool.debugsetting.help.legend: These are all plugin settings which can be updated.
tool.debugsetting.reloadplugin.alert.sub: Settings have been updated, plugin need to be restarted
error.popover.title: Error(s) detected
manufacturer.casaia.subtitle: subtitle
manufacturer.casaia.name: name
resetSwitchSelectorPushButton: Number of sec after the Selector is reset to Off
setting.subtitle.ManufSpecifiqDevicePoll: 0 stands for disable otherwise it indicates the polling frequency in seconds, For Manufacturer Specific it will allow to retreive device states whcih are not provided automatically by the device
resetMotiondelay: Delay in sec to reset motion detection
alarmDuration: Duration in sec for Alarm device
PowerOn_OnOff: Return state after device power outage
capturePairingInfos: Capture Pairing infos and save in Reports folder
network.topo.visu.network.relation.heade: List of children of the selected object
network.topo.visu.network.relation.subti: The array displays the LQI value between the selected object and all of its child objects.
network.topo.visu.network.relation.nochi: The selected object doesn't have any children.
